definitions: affected by alcohol to the point of losing physical and mental control
examples: The inebriated guest stumbled through the doorway
He was too inebriated to drive home safely

definitions: impossible or unsafe to eat because of being toxic, spoiled, or unpalatable
examples: The mushrooms in the forest were completely inedible
The overcooked meat had become tough and inedible

definitions: too great, extreme, or beautiful to be described or expressed in words
examples: She felt an ineffable joy at seeing her child
The ineffable beauty of the sunset left them speechless

definitions: failing to produce the desired or intended result; not having effect
examples: The ineffective treatment failed to cure the disease
His ineffective leadership led to the project's failure

definitions: lacking the ability, influence, or power to produce a desired effect
examples: His ineffectual attempts to fix the problem only made it worse
The ineffectual manager couldn't motivate the team

definitions: not achieving maximum productivity; wasting time, money, or energy in operation
examples: The inefficient heating system wasted too much energy
Their inefficient work methods slowed down production considerably

definitions: not meeting the necessary requirements or conditions to be chosen or participate
examples: He was ineligible for the scholarship due to his grades
Foreign citizens are ineligible to vote in national elections

definitions: having or showing no skill; clumsy and incompetent in performance
not suitable or appropriate for the circumstances; poorly chosen
examples: The inept waiter spilled soup on several customers
His inept handling of the crisis made everything worse
Her inept comment offended everyone at the meeting
The politician's inept response damaged his reputation

definitions: not fair or just; showing bias or favoritism in treatment
examples: The inequitable distribution of resources caused social unrest
They protested against the inequitable treatment of workers

definitions: lacking the ability or strength to move; showing no activity
having little or no ability to react chemically with other substances
examples: The injured animal lay inert on the ground
The inert body showed no signs of life
Helium is an inert gas that doesn't react easily
The inert ingredients in medicine have no therapeutic effect

definitions: unable to be avoided, ignored, or denied; certain to happen
examples: Death is an inescapable fact of human existence
The inescapable conclusion was that he had lied

definitions: certain to happen; unable to be avoided or prevented from occurring
examples: Change is inevitable in any growing organization
The inevitable result of overspending is bankruptcy

definitions: impossible to use up completely; available in unlimited quantity or extent
examples: She seemed to have an inexhaustible supply of energy
The inexhaustible resources of the ocean amazed scientists

definitions: impossible to stop or prevent; continuing without any possibility of being stopped
examples: The inexorable march of time affects us all
Economic forces led to an inexorable decline in manufacturing

definitions: not costing much money; available at a low or reasonable price
examples: They found an inexpensive restaurant near the station
These inexpensive shoes are perfect for everyday wear

definitions: having little knowledge or skill in a particular area from lack of experience
examples: The inexperienced driver struggled with parallel parking
An inexperienced teacher may have difficulty managing the classroom

definitions: unable to be explained or understood; not having a clear or obvious cause
examples: His inexplicable behavior worried his family and friends
There was an inexplicable delay in the project completion

definitions: incapable of making mistakes or being wrong; always effective and accurate
examples: No human being is infallible in their judgment
She had an infallible memory for names and faces

definitions: well known for some bad quality or deed; having an extremely bad reputation
examples: The infamous criminal was finally captured by police
This restaurant is infamous for its terrible service

definitions: displaying behavior typical of a very young child; immature and silly
of or relating to infants or infancy; occurring in babies
examples: His infantile behavior embarrassed everyone at the party
Their infantile arguing was getting on everyone's nerves
The doctor specialized in infantile diseases and disorders
Infantile reflexes disappear as the baby grows

definitions: possessed with an intense but short-lived passion or attraction for someone
examples: He became infatuated with his new colleague immediately
The infatuated teenager wrote love poems every day

definitions: not possible to do easily or conveniently; impractical or unworkable
examples: The proposed solution was infeasible given our budget
Building a bridge there is infeasible due to terrain

definitions: affected with a disease-causing organism such as bacteria or virus
contaminated with malicious software that damages or disrupts computer systems
examples: The infected wound required immediate medical attention
Several infected patients were quarantined in the hospital
The infected computer spread viruses throughout the network
An infected file corrupted the entire hard drive

definitions: liable to be transmitted to people through the environment; causing infection
spreading quickly from one person to another in a group
examples: Measles is a highly infectious disease among children
The infectious bacteria spread rapidly through the hospital
Her infectious laughter made everyone in the room smile
His infectious enthusiasm motivated the entire team

definitions: able to cause infection; containing disease-causing organisms that can spread
examples: The infective dose varies depending on the pathogen
Infective agents were found in the water supply

definitions: derived by reasoning or concluded from evidence rather than explicit statements
examples: The inferential statistics supported the research hypothesis
Her inferential reasoning led to the correct conclusion

definitions: lower in quality, value, or importance compared to something else
lower in rank, status, or position in a hierarchy
examples: The inferior product failed to meet quality standards
They refused to accept inferior working conditions
Junior officers are inferior to senior commanders in rank
The inferior court's decision was overturned on appeal

definitions: of, relating to, or characteristic of hell or the underworld
irritating and tiresome in the extreme; used for emphasis
examples: The painting depicted infernal regions of eternal punishment
Dante wrote about the infernal circles of hell
That infernal noise kept me awake all night
The infernal machine finally broke down completely

definitions: unable to reproduce offspring or achieve pregnancy after trying
unable to sustain plant growth; lacking nutrients needed for cultivation
examples: The infertile couple sought help from fertility specialists
Many infertile women benefit from modern reproductive technology
The infertile soil couldn't support any agricultural crops
Years of drought left the land dry and infertile

definitions: limitless or endless in space, extent, or size; impossible to measure
examples: The universe may contain infinite stars and galaxies
She showed infinite patience with the difficult student

definitions: immeasurably or incalculably small; so tiny as to be almost nothing
examples: The chances of winning were infinitesimal but not zero
An infinitesimal amount of poison can be lethal

definitions: not physically strong, especially due to age or long illness
examples: The infirm elderly woman needed help walking upstairs
He became increasingly infirm in his final years

definitions: affected by inflammation; red, swollen, and often painful
filled with or showing strong emotion, especially anger
examples: The inflamed tissue around the wound was tender
His inflamed joints made movement extremely painful
The inflamed crowd demanded justice for the victims
Inflamed passions led to violent confrontations

definitions: relating to or causing inflammation of body tissue
intended to arouse angry or violent feelings; provocative
examples: Certain foods can trigger inflammatory responses in the body
The doctor prescribed anti-inflammatory medication
His inflammatory speech caused riots in the streets
The newspaper published inflammatory articles about immigration

definitions: designed to be filled with air or gas to achieve full size
examples: The children played with an inflatable swimming pool
An inflatable mattress is perfect for camping trips

definitions: expanded by filling with air or gas; blown up
increased beyond what is reasonable or appropriate; exaggerated
examples: The inflated balloon floated up to the ceiling
Properly inflated tires improve fuel efficiency
The inflated prices shocked tourists visiting the resort
His inflated ego made him difficult to work with

definitions: relating to or tending to cause inflation in an economy
examples: The government worried about inflationary pressures on the economy
Inflationary policies led to rising costs of living

definitions: unable to bend or be bent; rigid and not pliable
unwilling to change or compromise; stubborn about rules or decisions
examples: The inflexible metal rod couldn't fit through the opening
His injured back had become stiff and inflexible
The inflexible rules allowed no exceptions whatsoever
Her inflexible attitude made negotiations impossible

definitions: having great influence on someone or something; wielding power to affect outcomes
examples: She became an influential figure in modern art
The influential newspaper shaped public opinion significantly

definitions: having a relaxed, friendly, or unofficial style, manner, or nature
examples: The meeting had an informal atmosphere without strict rules
She prefers informal clothing for weekend activities

definitions: designed or intended to give facts or information about something
examples: The website includes several informational videos about health
Students attended an informational session about college applications

definitions: providing useful or interesting information; serving to increase knowledge
examples: The informative lecture helped students understand complex concepts
She wrote an informative article about climate change

definitions: having or showing knowledge of a particular subject or situation
examples: She made an informed decision after researching thoroughly
Informed citizens are essential for a healthy democracy

definitions: having wavelengths longer than visible red light but shorter than radio waves
examples: Infrared cameras can detect heat in complete darkness
The infrared sensor measured the object's temperature

definitions: not occurring often; happening rarely or at long intervals
examples: His infrequent visits home worried his parents greatly
Rain is infrequent in this desert region

definitions: made extremely angry and impatient; filled with fury
examples: The infuriated customer demanded to see the manager
She was infuriated by their constant interruptions

definitions: causing extreme anger and impatience; extremely annoying or frustrating
examples: The infuriating delay caused us to miss our flight
His infuriating habit of being late upset everyone

definitions: showing clever inventiveness and skill; marked by originality and resourcefulness
examples: The engineer devised an ingenious solution to the problem
Her ingenious design won the innovation award

definitions: firmly fixed or established; difficult to change because of long existence
examples: His ingrained habits were hard to break after decades
Ingrained prejudices prevented them from seeing the truth

definitions: occupied as a place of residence; having people living there
examples: The inhabited island had a small fishing community
This area has been continuously inhabited for centuries
